CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Phone Screen stage positioned above or below the Application Submitted stage?
SRP.A: The Phone Screen stage is positioned {below} the Application Submitted stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {logarithmic} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage HR Interview?
VE.A: The value of stage HR Interview is {22%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Job Posting Viewed?
VE.A: The value of stage Job Posting Viewed is {100%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Technical Interview?
VE.A: The value of stage Technical Interview is {14%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Job Posting Viewed, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Offer Extended, with a value of {12%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Application Submitted to stage Phone Screen?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Application Submitted to stage Phone Screen is {23%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Technical Interview to stage Offer Extended?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Technical Interview to stage Offer Extended is {2%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 80%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 13%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 18% and 30%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Phone Screen to HR Interview, or from stage Technical Interview to Offer Extended?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Phone Screen} to {HR Interview} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Phone Screen to HR Interview, from stage Technical Interview to Offer Extended, or from stage Job Posting Viewed to Application Submitted?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Job Posting Viewed} to stage {Application Submitted} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Job Posting Viewed} and {Application Submitted} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Technical Interview} and {Offer Extended} stages.
